alert.note: Alert for Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 10:12PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Custer, western Fall River and southeastern Weston Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1012 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dewey, or 19 miles northwest of Edgemont, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs, Edgemont, Dewey, Buffalo Gap, Argyle, Cottonwood Springs Dam, Burdock, Cascade Falls, Maverick Junction, Cold Brook Reservoir, northwestern Angostura Reservoir and southwestern Wind Cave National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
